attributes.action: International British Medical Students should be funded by the Government (SFE).
attributes.background: NHS has a massive shortage of doctors. British Medical Students studying in international universities have to take on great financial burdens to achieve their dreams of becoming doctors. These students are then coming back to the UK to support our NHS. So, shouldn't the government support them!
attributes.additional_details: Student Finance England (SFE) should support British Medical Students studying in European or International Medical Universities.  NHS has a massive shortage of doctors. British Medical Students studying in international universities have to take on great financial burdens to achieve their dreams of becoming doctors. These students are then coming back to the UK to support our NHS. So, shouldn't the government support them! These students are the backbone of the NHS!

attributes.action: Ban the sale of cigarettes in corner shops, only sell them in the supermarket
attributes.background: This will make younger people hard to buy the cigarette from the corner and this will make them go to the top 4 supermarkets because the supermarket will ask for ID and some corner shop do not ask for ID. This will help more people quit smoking and never start smoking in the first place.

attributes.action: Redirect funds gained from taxing 'Legal Highs' to Safe Housing & Rehab Centres
attributes.background:
Formally Legal highs started out as a legal recreational drug, found in many shops in the UK and often seen in use in festivals. 
Fast forward 10 years and the now illegal  psychoactive substances leave addicts with side effects, paranoia, coma, seizures and death with no specialised support.
attributes.additional_details: Prior to the new legislation ( The Psychoactive Substances Act May 2016)  ' legal high' was the title given to  substances sold that emulated illegal drugs such as cocaine,heroin, speed, cannabis. It could be found sold in shops/festivals/online. Since the Ban was enforced these psychoactive drugs have been forced underground and are now even more dangerous. I suggest that any taxes gathered from the years that the drug was 'legal ' should be redirected in specific rehab and homeless centres.

attributes.action: Equality for men. Ban the use of urinals. Men should not be expected to use them
attributes.background: Women are able to urinate in private so why are men men expected to use urinals?  Yes, cubicles are also provided in most cases but they are typically being used by somebody that needs to do the alternative.  Men are under pressure to urinate next to another man despite the privacy concern.
attributes.additional_details: The smells that are emitted from the majority of urinals are awful. In addition, spare a thought for the cleaners. Also, banning the use of urinals would save an enormous quantity of water as the urinals typically flush automatically even when they are not being used. The time has come to provide equality for men and give us some privacy.

attributes.action:
Higher Minimum Wage for anti-social hours
(11pm-6am).
attributes.background: Sometimes an employer will pay staff who work anti-social hours a higher wage than those who work normal hours, but not very often; especially in the bar industy. Working anti-social hours can put a strain on the health and limits people's chances to join in on family and social life.
attributes.additional_details: Unfortunately, there is no legal entitlement to increased pay for working anti-social hours, and I think this should change! Thanks

attributes.action: Force companies to publish age statistics of their workforce
attributes.background: The UK government predicts that by 2020 a third of workers will be over the age of 50 and by 2039 the state pension age will be 68. Yet despite our ageing workforce, discrimination against older workers is a problem that is likely to worsen.
attributes.additional_details:
The discrimination also occurs in recruitment, where it has a big impact. There is significant research that backs up the fact people over 55 (and especially women) are less likely to get job interviews than younger people.

Many older workers are forced to become self-employed and find contract work to make ends meet when they would prefer to find a permanent job.

Reporting on mean, median and hiring ratios vs applicants would ensure less bias.

attributes.action: Ban social media that doesnt confirm your age officially or allows you anonymity
attributes.background: Social media is far too often used as a barrier to hide behind and bully others. Snapchat, Facebook, Sarahah, need to start confirming children's ages with official documents and stop allowing users to remain anonymous. Bullying can kill and it must be stopped.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for public toilets to have better personal hygiene facilities
attributes.background: Everyday hundred of thousands of Britons use public bathrooms and there is only ever tissue! How can anyone clean them selves properly with just tissue. This also means that hundereds of thousand of Britons are walking around with with feces (harmful bacteria) on their bodies. It needs to change!
attributes.additional_details: more suitable cleaning apparatus EG: a Bidet shower

attributes.action: To get more hospitals and health care centres back in local areas across the UK
attributes.background: Lack of hospitals and health care centres in Hertfordshire is a major issue as the nearest hospital is 18.5 miles and 36 minuets away this is not including traffic and other altercations.
attributes.additional_details: A hard working student striving to be the best at Longdean school was unfortunately caught up in an car accident, it was shocking to all the students and staff at this school, even more shocking was that it took 1 hour and 30 minuets for an ambulance to reach her and luckily she was  not injured and walked away with out a scratch but this was a wake up call to the students at Longdean school, to take action and create this petition.

attributes.action: Lower wait time for new universal credit claims
attributes.background: The current wait time for new universal credit claims is 5 weeks. This means low income families go without money for that period and puts families in severe hardship. Tax credit claims by contrast only take 3 weeks. We need to speed this up to save families from making difficult decisions.

attributes.action: ILR easier to get for spouse of British citizen married 5 years+ wt British kids
attributes.background: British citizens who marry non citizens have the right to live with their spouses in the UK especially when it is obvious that their marriage is sincere with British children together. Please stop separating families.  The criteria to qualify for Indefinite Leave to Remain is too strict.
attributes.additional_details: Couples who marry within or outside the UK and have been married for over 5 years are obviously sincere. Having children together makes them more sincere. A desire to work and not access public funds makes them value added to British society. Please encourage families to stay together and live happily in the UK. Please stop encouraging mothers to be single and creating dysfunctional children due to absent fathers. UK is the UNITED KINGDOM not DIVIDED KINGDOM. Keep love and unity as the motto.

attributes.action: More funding for the treatment of schizophrenia and chronic mental illnesses.
attributes.background: It is estimated that 1 in 6 people in the uk have a mental illness of some kind during their lifetime. At any one time about 220,000 people are being treated directly for schizophrenia in the UK by the NHS. Sufferers have the highest rates of suicide partly due to the Ill side effects of neuroleptic
attributes.additional_details:
More funding is needed to find a possible alternative to antipsychotics like cbd oil which has the potential to cure the disease short term without the side effects associated with neuroleptics.

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/ministryofhemp.com/blog/cbd-for-schizophrenia/amp/

https://www.livingwithschizophreniauk.org/facts-and-figures/

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-17940070

attributes.action: Changing the legal age for vaping WITHOUT nicotine from 18 to 16.
attributes.background: By lowering the age from 18 to 16 will allow young people who smoke to turn to a safer alternative. This will lower the lung cancer rate in young people. Save lives and lower the vaping age.

attributes.action: Delay the introduction of accountable care organisations
attributes.background: Delay the introduction of accountable care organisations till after the Health Committee has the opportunity to review the evidence of their potential impact on the NHS.
attributes.additional_details: ACOs are about saving money and closing services. The Secretary of State for Health needs to refrain from introducing them behind Parliament's back.

attributes.action: Modify the election system for MPs to make it more democratic and representative
attributes.background: Parliament and MPs have lost the respect and trust of the majority of UK citizens. Parliament is perceived as representing MPs, political families and the rich. This applies to all UK political parties. The system of PD has been hijacked by interests from outside the UK with the support of UK MPs.
attributes.additional_details:
Replace the present election system with one that requires 25% of MPs to stand for re-election each year.  Ensure that the list of those needing to stand is random and cannot be fixed by political parties. Ensure all MPs have to stand for re-election during a Parliament.  Publish, in mainstream media, attendance and voting records of all MPs standing for re-election.
 The annual election of a proportion of Local Councillors has worked for many years. It is important to show MPs are honest people

attributes.action: Close planning loophole that allows homes to be converted to care homes
attributes.background: Make "Assisted Living" a category subject to planning regulation & approval, including drug, alcohol & mental health rehab. Planning regulations need urgently to be amended to protect private residential property owners.
attributes.additional_details: Local authorities can be powerless to stop homes being converted into care homes because the law is not clear enough. A new "Assisted Living" category would give local authorities and local residents proper powers to challenge new care homes being set up.

attributes.action: UK must ratify the optional protocol to the UN Rights of the Child Convention.
attributes.background: This important addition to the Convention gives members of the public and child sexual abuse victims the right to directly raise issues & complaints with the UN Committe on the Rights of the Child and its members. The majority of EU countries have ratified but the UK is conspicuous by its absence.
attributes.additional_details: The unratifed "communication" protocol  allows child sex abuse victims to raise complaints directly with the UN Committee in relation to public authorities failing to safeguard and protect children in relation to child sexual abuse after exhausting all internal remedies. That this protocol has not been ratified is bizarre given the UK's failings in this area.  Failings which have become somewhat of a daily news occurrence in recent years.  It would give individual abuse victims a voice at the UN.

attributes.action: Streamline UK education by creating a single/governmental exam board
attributes.background: I'm at my 1st year of university. A lot of time is wasted covering content covered at A level; this was also true for A level regarding GCSEs. Why? Because multiple exam boards mean students don't cover the same content, so it has to be taught again at the next level of education.
attributes.additional_details:
One exam board would stop this.

Furthermore, revision resources are poor. But, converting to one exam board will create a single/larger market for people to produce educational content for, meaning it can be higher quality.

E.g. 2 At A-level, I wanted to produce a revision site for A-level STEM subjects, however it is a waste of time because too few students would use it, because there is too much content between the 5 different exam boards.

attributes.action: Make it law for all age restricted products to require approved photo ID.
attributes.background: Across the country retail workers face verbal and physical abuse because of asking to see ID. The guessing of a customers age is what causes these cases of abuse with customers trying to intimidate the member of staff into selling the product. A no ID no sale law would put an end to the daily abuse.
attributes.additional_details: Evidence shows that there are more than 6000 incidents a day of verbal or physical abuse of retail workers because they requested to see ID for an age restricted product. A simple law that states no ID no sale on all age restricted products would remove the possibility of human error in having to guess people's ages and would help to stop the verbal and physical abuse that occurs because of this.

attributes.action: Change legislation around air pollution caused by fireworks, to improve health.
attributes.background: It’s the beginning of a new year and in many countries around the world, it has become a tradition to set off thousands of fireworks in elaborate displays. But if we stopped to consider the environmental impact of such extravagance, would we still choose this option or go for a safer, greener option
attributes.additional_details: Firework smoke has been shown to significantly increase breathing problems and have increased toxicity compared to traffic pollution. In this technologically advanced world we live in, surely we have the ability to come up with more inventive ways of using music, lights, and water displays to commemorate the new year.  In 2018, authorities in Dubai opted to light up the Burj Khalifa in a sensational display without fireworks, proving it can be done. We could save millions & our health-pls sign.

attributes.action: Exempt Charities from paying Insurance Premium Tax (IPT)
attributes.background: We believe the Government should be doing everything it can to support the vital work charities are doing, not imposing unnecessary costs on them. We call for charities to be exempted from Insurance Premium Tax (IPT).
attributes.additional_details: The Government could introduce an exemption from, or reduction in, IPT for all UK Charities. A further rise in the rate of standard UK IPT was announced recently. From 1st June 2017 IPT charged on charities' insurance premiums increased to 12%. This represents a 100% increase in an 18 month period. These increases have and will continue to negatively affect charities who have already suffered in the last few years from reduced income while seeing an increase in the demand for their services.

attributes.action: Offset any rise in the price of fuel
attributes.background: As Christmas is approaching, I would like to propose that if the price of a litre of fuel is to rise by 3p then the government should reduce the amount of tax on fuel by the very same amount. As a result, motorists will not be impacted by any fuel cost rises.

attributes.action: Rebate and partially rebate stamp duty on properties purchased since 22/11/16
attributes.background: The new stamp duty rules for houses under 300k and only partial for above is great news for new buyers. I was a new buyer 5 months ago and struggled to get stamp duty together.
attributes.additional_details: I feel that following the chancellor’s revelation on the 22/11/17, all properties purchased within the last 12 months, particularly ones purchased using help to buy, should have partial or full refunds on the stamp duty in line with the chancellor’s new ruled surrounding stamp duty

attributes.action: Make rent to own companies illegal
attributes.background: Some companies’ lending practices are targeting the "poorest, most desperate families" and operating in the "most deprived areas" of the UK. The customers end up paying more than twice what they would have paid without finance charges. This is making people already in debt further in debt.
attributes.additional_details: There is evidence that they are targeting the UK's most vulnerable (poorest and most desperate families), and operating in the most deprived areas. Customers end up paying more than twice what they would have paid without finance charges. Some base prices have also been noted to be higher than those of upscale mainstream retailers such as Harrods. This is totally unacceptable, with the interest rates in need of review.

attributes.action: Change and restrict the dates for sale of fireworks around bonfire night.
attributes.background: We all know that bans do not work, we all know that bonfire night isn't going anywhere, but did you know that the sale of fireworks around bonfire night starts from the 15th of October to the 8th of November that's 25 days of sale. Potentially 4 weeks of fireworks going off in any one area.
attributes.additional_details:
There are members of the public who are not sensible and continuously break the law, setting off fireworks in proximity to peoples homes and even terrorising and subjecting abuse to other members of the public for up to the whole 4 weeks of sale. Unfortunately animals are also very easily abused with fireworks too, many incidents include tieing them to animals and setting them off.
I call to get the sale dates changed and restricted to less than 14 days around the time of bonfire night.

attributes.action: Ban any future police usage of brainwave scanners (electroencephalograms).
attributes.background: EEG's read brainwaves and can compute, so far, very simple thoughts - with around 60 - 90% accuracy. Introduction of these, upon further development, voids the point of the majority of the police force and is a gross breach of human rights.
attributes.additional_details: In a world becoming more and more technological, there is only one true privacy left - the brain. Introduction of EEG's to the police force would bring Britain on a par with George Orwell's 1984, and would take away yet more power from the public - the people the Government are supposed to serve. EEG's should still be available to services such as the NHS, as with some development, people with locked in syndrome could communicate again. Apart from that, they should be illegal or banned.

attributes.action: To made possible to claim disability discrimination when applying for a school.
attributes.background: Currently, the law prevents to make an appeal on disability discrimination case against Local Authority when they fail to secure a place at chosen school. The decision is made by Local Authority and SEND Tribunal can only act aginst schools.
attributes.additional_details: Under Schedule 17 of the Equality Act, 2010 Tribunal Special Educational Needs and Disability only has the power to consider a claim against the responsible body for school and cannot consider a claim against the local authority for the exercise of powers to determine the admission. The decision about child admission is made by local authority only and if the process is not correct parents cannot pursuit claim of disability discrimination against the local authority.

attributes.action: Refuse to take part in war in Syria and find a diplomatic path to peace
attributes.background: Bombing Syria will not help the situation. It will kill more civilians and ignite a conflict that could spiral out of control, causing massive devastation. We call on the government to refuse to engage in the conflict. Focus on political solutions and aiding diplomacy between the US and Russia
attributes.additional_details: A conflict in Syria between U.S. and Russian forces is not only something that we cannot afford to take part in, it's something we should do everything in our power to prevent. The potential consequences of such a conflict - a huge civilian death toll and the risk of igniting nuclear war - are things that need to be avoided at all costs. We urge the government not to take part in any military action in Syria but instead, with urgency, focus all available resources on finding political solutions and aiding diplomatic relations between the U.S. and Russian governments.

attributes.action: MPs must have a vote before the UK engages with military action in Libya
attributes.background: Further to previous Middle East conflicts and their outcome, it is imperative that we have a democratic vote by elected MPs on whether the UK should be involved in an escalation of military activity in Libya

attributes.action: Write all laws in Plain English
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, believe that in order for the majority of the people to fully participate in the governance of the country, our laws should be written in a language that the people can readily understand.
attributes.additional_details:
We further believe that the current practice of drafting and presenting laws in Legal English and “Legalese” is detrimental to a truly representative Parliament and the involvement of the people in the government of the country.

We therefore demand that all future laws made in the UK Parliament should be written in Plain English.

attributes.action: Legalise the permanent removal of front number plates.
attributes.background: As an avid car modifier and petrolhead, I and most people know find that the front number plates on our vehicles can really stand out more than we want and slightly ruin the look and aesthetic of the vehicle.
attributes.additional_details: The ability to permanently remove the front number plate could also reduce the risk of number plate theft by criminals as there are less possibilities. People say that it gives more opportunities for crime to be committed using the car but if the police never chase from the front so their DVLA scanners would still be able to correctly operate. The issue of speed cameras could be resolved by simply making them double sided so that they can capture criminals from both sides of the road.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of peanut products in cinemas
attributes.background: Going to the cinema can be a traumatic time for many people with a peanut/nut allergy. Spending most of the time looking around to make sure that someone next to you is not about to open a packet of Peanut M&M’s or another product containing peanuts. Families should feel safe in a place of enjoyment
attributes.additional_details:
Peanut allergies affect 1 in 55 children in the UK, why put our children at risk in a place that is suppose to be enjoyable? 
 Every cinema I have visited in the UK so far sells Peanut M&M’s as a film-time snack. Are there not enough other snacks available without the need to sell peanut based products?? 
 Nuts are in the top 3 most common food allergies in the UK to date, and with this allergy being also airborne this causes more of a danger in close public spaces such as cinemas.

attributes.action: Ask the EU under Article 50(3) TFEU to extend the period before Brexit
attributes.background: Our future as a global trading nation hangs on our future relationship with the EU. That is far from certain and we need time to develop it. Once we leave the EU, our position will be weaker across the board. We should not  burn that bridge and move into the transition without more clarity.
attributes.additional_details: During the proposed transition, the UK will be a rule-taker, not a rule-maker. It will be able to sign – but not implement- trade agreements with partners outside the EU. There is no clear evidence of the availability, terms or value of such deals, and potential partners will wish to know the UK's future relationship with the EU before committing themselves. The Transition is too uncertain. We should not leave our existing terms with the EU before we are sure we are headed for a better future.

attributes.action: Introduce a South African Vulnerable Persons' Resettlement Programme
attributes.background:
- 1,700 people have been killed in farm attacks in two decades 
- In 2016/17 torture was used in 17.6% of murders 
- the South African Parliament decided in Feb to approve a motion in favour of “the expropriation of [white-owned] land without compensation”.
attributes.additional_details:
- In 2014 Britain established the Syrian Vulnerable Person Resettlement Programme (VPRP). Since June 2017 all those admitted to the UK under the VPRP have been granted refugee status. 
- We therefore merely call for equal treatment by the British government for South Africa.”

attributes.action: Don't allow councils to use private companies as Civil Enforcement Officers
attributes.background: Councils are subcontracting their Enforcement Officers to private companies. It has been highlighted in the news and in a damning panorama report, private companies are out for profit and cannot make the right moral decisions. These powers need to remain with local council Civil Enforcement Officers
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-39882434

attributes.action: Make up-skirt photography an illegal offence in the UK
attributes.background: Upskirting is the act of taking a photograph of underneath a person's skirt without their consent. It is often performed in a public place such as on public transport or on an escalator. Many women across the UK are targeted in places such as nightclubs, restaurants and shops. This needs to stop.
attributes.additional_details: In Scotland, Upskirting is an illegal offence, and has been since 2010. Victims and police are only able to pursue offences of voyeurism and indecency, with a Freedom of Information request made by the Press Association revealing that the police have pursued 78 offences related to upskirting since 2015 - but only 11 led to alleged offenders being charged.

attributes.action: Ban the production and sale of non-recycled toilet paper in this country.
attributes.background: All of us use toilet paper every day.  Has it ever occurred to you that most toilet paper is made from new trees?  Recycled toilet paper is not widely available in shops in this country.  It should be the only option available because of the huge negative impact it has on the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are some facts (http://www.theworldcounts.com/counters/how_consumerism_affects_the_environment/toilet_paper_environmental_impact):

- The toilet paper we use could go around the planet every 2 minutes, or travel to the sun and back every 10 days.

- The difference between using new toilet paper and toilet paper made from recycled materials is 400 million trees, 660 million tons of water, and 45 million tons of oil.

attributes.action: Bring back nit nurse to UK schools send them home till treated and clear 2018
attributes.background:
Sick of nits £££ on products such as treatments and repellents.
Hours spent combing through hair.
Laundry through constant washing.
Kids crying you pulling and tugging to the point you want to shave their head.
attributes.additional_details:
Abroad they still have nit nurses that come to check children’s heads in school regularly, once head lice are found the child is sent home and not allowed to return till rechecked and cleared.
I lived abroad and this works 100%.
Eliminates before it can even start to spread.
Desperate mum of a girl with beautiful long hair that seriously can’t take this anymore.

attributes.action: Make financial management a compulsory part of education in schools
attributes.background:
The national level of personal debt in this country is on the rise. It will only get worse unless something is done now.

Proper financial management has to be taught in schools from a young age to prepare children for the future.

This could be included in maths or done as a separate subject.
attributes.additional_details:
I work in local government, dealing with insolvency and large debts on a daily basis. I've seen so many cases where people clearly don't know how to manage their finances and need solid advice on how to budget.

National statistics for Individual Voluntary Arrangements (IVAs) show that they are steadily on the rise since their introduction. However, I've seen several terminted because people can't make enough sacrifices and stick to arrangements. This then leads to harsher financial penalties.

attributes.action: Abolish school uniform in all schools.
attributes.background: School uniform rules have recently become too strict, to the point where people are being suspended from school for their appearance. We preach about not missing education yet we stop it over cloth and dye? Teenagers should express themselves and not be punished for being unique.
attributes.additional_details: When a student has done something particularly bad like get into a fight or bully another student we suspend them or put them in isolation to punish the student. Why is a student with blue hair or with a t-shirt being punished at the same level? We encourage students to 'be themselves' yet we confine this with rules. Teenagers already struggle in schools with exams, hormones, sexuality etc. We shouldn't be giving them more reasons to stress out. Casual dress-code doesn't stop them learning.

attributes.action: Start development of a satellite carrier rocket.
attributes.background: During the 1960s a British rocket named Black Arrow was created that was capable of launching payloads into orbit. However, the program was cancelled in order to save money which left the UK the only country to successfully develop and then cancel an indigenous space rocket.
attributes.additional_details:
-Black Arrow was cancelled in order to save cost, however it was a comparatively cheap rocket design.
-All other countries that have successfully developed rocket technologies have continued to develop them further.
-The lack of our own launch system has led us to rely on foreign countries, such as the Russian Soyuz rocket, which we could be prevented from using their equipment if we fall out of favour with their governments.

attributes.action: Increase the driving age to 21
attributes.background: I believe that being able to drive at 17 is far too young and the age limit should be increased to 21 to try and save lives

attributes.action: Start a voluntary emigration programme for people who want to leave the UK.
attributes.background: I am sick and tired of living in a small country with an ever increasing population and lack of government investment in jobs, housing, opportunities, transport, healthcare and poor standard of living.
attributes.additional_details:
You would be paid up to £100,000 by the Government to give up your British citizenship, if you’re entitled to another citizenship, in exchange for leaving the UK to settle elsewhere.

 

A contract can be signed, so that if someone changes their mind they will be liable to pay back the sum of money, if they want to gain back their citizenship. They will also not be able to join the scheme again.

attributes.action: All EU powers should return to Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland after Brexit
attributes.background: The UK government is saying that they need to reserve some powers after Brexit to protect the UK single market.  But that’s not necessarily true.  What they’re proposing would actually damage the UK and the UK single market.  So I call on the UK to automatically devolve all of these EU powers.
attributes.additional_details: Devolving all these powers would might prevent the break up of the UK.  Whereas, what the UK government is proposing would actually break Britain up.  So I would like to see a cross-party discussion on this.

attributes.action: Restrict social media use by children to help prevent cyberbullying
attributes.background:
We urge Parliament to consider new laws, banning the posting of content to social media / video-sharing sites by under-18s. 

Children should be focussed on developing real life social skills, and deserve a childhood free from the pressures and bullying which go hand in hand with social media use.
attributes.additional_details:
Social media / video-sharing websites are often used as a way to bully other children, and in some cases teachers too, something from which the victim has no opportunity to escape, even at home.

Children should not be posting content online, until they have reached an age at which they have been fully educated about its use/misuse, can understand the emotional damage bullying online may cause, and the legal ramifications of broadcasting inappropriate content or making libelous remarks online.

attributes.action: Legally binding target to give men and women equal life expectancy.
attributes.background: End the worst gender inequality of them all - refocus health resources to give men and women equal life expectancy. The ONS states that the average life expectancy is 79 years for men and 83 years for women. This is a shocking discrimination against men, in the most fundamental way - life itself.
attributes.additional_details: The government should re-direct NHS resources to close the 4-year gap. No child should be born to a shorter life simply by being born male. Medical opinion is that there is no basic reason why women should live longer than men - so resources in research, treatment, health education etc. should be focused on men's health until the gap is closed.

attributes.action: Make Recycling Compulsory
attributes.background: The united kingdom is falling behind on the amount of recycling compared to other European countries. We could fix this by making recycling compulsory, a tax reduction (similar to charity donations) and education for younger generations that will encourage new generations to recycle more often.
attributes.additional_details: The United Kingdom is falling behind on recycling rates compared to other developed nations such as France and Germany causing 60% of waste going to landfill. This needs to change. I propose that we can end this through making recycling compulsory, through methods such as: an increase tax for if landfill waste increases, a tax reduction for companies that increase the percentage recycled, similar to charity donations and encouraging new generations to recycle through education within schools.

attributes.action: Reform the law on incarcerating drug addicts, introducing harm reduction clinics
attributes.background: The 'Harm Reduction' drug policy used in Switzerland in the 1980's  has had a range of positive impacts on addicts, and should be used in the UK.Two-Thirds of the addicts who entered the harm-reduction clinics found full time jobs as they did not spend their time and money financing their addiction.
attributes.additional_details:
- http://vancouver.ca/people-programs/four-pillars-drug-strategy.aspx
 - https://www.globalcommissionondrugs.org/the-hardline-approach-to-drugs-must-end-by-richard-branson/
- http://www.smh.com.au/comment/swiss-recipe-for-dealing-with-drug-addiction-proves-a-success-20130622-2opcj.html

The benefits that addicts can receive from the harm reduction strategy hugely outweighs the 'positives' brought by the more traditional, hard-line policy that punishes and incarcerates addicts which inevitably worsens their addiction and leaves them stripped of opportunities when released.

attributes.action: Nationalise the 3rd party element of vehicle insurance to benefit young drivers.
attributes.background: My partner's daughter's insurance was £2000 per annum for any car before any accidents at the age of 18. She now has had an accident that wasn't her fault and the new premium will be £4000 per annum. She cannot use public transport to get to her job. This premium represents more than half her wages.
attributes.additional_details: Any alternative system exists in New Zealand and is quoted by Wikipedia as follows - "Within New Zealand, the Accident Compensation Corporation (ACC) provides nationwide no-fault personal injury insurance.[9] Injuries involving motor vehicles operating on public roads are covered by the Motor Vehicle Account, for which premiums are collected through levies on petrol and through vehicle licensing fees."

attributes.action: Introduce compulsory 6 weeks Comunity Service for 18-year-olds
attributes.background: There are some 750,000 18-year-olds in the UK. Their service to our nation would not only be an invaluable help to our understaffed, overstretched national health and education services but would also reestablish the commitment and responsibility we, as individuals, feel towards our community.
attributes.additional_details: Our nation’s young adults are able to bring the energy, enthusiasm and hard work to revitalize our public service sectors. Driving ambulances, escorting elderly patients to and from medical procedures and helping out in the classroom (with the necessary background checks); these six weeks would provide not only an immense service to our country but also an ideological grounding for its citizens. The UK is experiencing a time of increasing social divide in which our people feel estranged from the nation as a whole. Working hands-on with members of our community would deepen our understanding of our society and revolutionize the role we feel we play in it. An elevated feeling of responsibly towards our society will prove imperative to its success.
